channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Venezuelans wonder who's in charge as Trump claims contact with Maduro's deputy
item.description: Venezuelans scrambled to understand who was in charge of their country after the U.S. captured Nicolás Maduro. President Trump offered an answer: The United States would take control of Venezuela.
item.content:encoded:
Venezuelans scrambled to understand who was in charge of their country after the U.S. captured Nicolás Maduro. President Trump offered an answer: The United States would take control of Venezuela.

(Image credit: Ariana Cubillos)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Who is María Corina Machado, Venezuela's Nobel Peace Prize winning opposition leader?
item.description: The United States has captured Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro. Opposition leader María Corina Machado has been one of his biggest critics.
item.content:encoded:
The United States has captured Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro. Opposition leader María Corina Machado has been one of his biggest critics.

(Image credit: Stian Lysberg Solum)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Top House Democrat on what Congress should do next after Venezuela operation
item.description: U.S. Representative Adam Smith weighs in on the Trump administration's actions in Venezuela.
item.content:encoded: U.S. Representative Adam Smith weighs in on the Trump administration's actions in Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: Avery Keatley

item.title: What to know about the U.S. strikes in Venezuela — and the fallout
item.description: President Trump said the U.S. would "run" Venezuela, following the capture of President Nicolás Maduro on Saturday. But many questions remain about what's next.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump said the U.S. would "run" Venezuela, following the capture of President Nicolás Maduro on Saturday. But many questions remain about what's next.

(Image credit: Jesus Vargas)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Maduro faces drug charges in U.S. even as Trump freed others convicted of trafficking
item.description: Just last month, President Trump freed former Honduran President Juan Orlando Hernandez, who had been convicted in the U.S. of helping smuggle more than 400 tons of cocaine into the country.
item.content:encoded:
Just last month, President Trump freed former Honduran President Juan Orlando Hernandez, who had been convicted in the U.S. of helping smuggle more than 400 tons of cocaine into the country.

(Image credit: JIM WATSON)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: What are the charges against Venezuela's Nicolás Maduro?
item.description: The U.S. Justice Department has unsealed a new indictment alleging "drug trafficking and narco-terrorism conspiracies" against Maduro, his wife and other defendants.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. Justice Department has unsealed a new indictment alleging "drug trafficking and narco-terrorism conspiracies" against Maduro, his wife and other defendants.

(Image credit: Alfredo Lasry R)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: How Miami Venezuelans are reacting to the U.S. attack
item.description: In Miami, Venezuelans are reacting to the U.S. military operation to take President Nicolás Maduro into custody.
item.content:encoded: In Miami, Venezuelans are reacting to the U.S. military operation to take President Nicolás Maduro into custody.
item.dc:creator: Greg Allen

item.title: Why 2025 was a not-so-fabulous year for Las Vegas tourism
item.description: NPR's Daniel Estrin talks to Slate's Luke Winkie about his reporting on tourism to Las Vegas. Winkie calls it "America's most-flailing destination city."
item.content:encoded: NPR's Daniel Estrin talks to Slate's Luke Winkie about his reporting on tourism to Las Vegas. Winkie calls it "America's most-flailing destination city."
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: Los Angeles wildfire survivors band together to reduce rebuilding costs
item.description: A year after the LA fires, some people who lost their homes are trying to bring down the price of rebuilding by buying services and goods together.
item.content:encoded: A year after the LA fires, some people who lost their homes are trying to bring down the price of rebuilding by buying services and goods together.
item.dc:creator: Libby Rainey

item.title: 'We are going to run the country,' Trump says after strike on Venezuela
item.description: President Trump claimed overnight that the United States carried out airstrikes in Venezuela and captured President Nicolás Maduro.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump claimed overnight that the United States carried out airstrikes in Venezuela and captured President Nicolás Maduro.

(Image credit: AFP)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn
